Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay near Pike Market”
Reviews.Author: jugodevegetales
Reviews.Content: The people at the desk were amiable and helpful. They recommended a place for brunch right down the street that was super and really reasonable called the Local 360 where I went every day. One of my favorite things about the Belltown was that they had free bikes to loan which came with helmets and two locks (cable and u lock). The room was clean and comfortable and had a fridge and microwave and coffee maker. I was able, therefore to make my oatmeal in the morning and then go to the 360 at 11 when they opened. They have 3 computers in a room near the front desk to do email etc so all my needs were cared for. It isn't fancy but I saved lots of money on my stay which I spent eating dinner at upscale restaurants with my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Goldenretriever1247
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within walking distance of most major locations. It is also within the "free" bus route so we were very pleased with the location. The hotel itself is older. It offers a microwave, coffee pot and frig in the room. The room was small with a double/queen bed. The TV was extremely small. The bathroom contained a small sink with very little room to put your "stuff". It was quiet at night so we were able to sleep. The room was very warm and we were unable to change the temperature. We used the fan that was helpful. Definitely would not stay there if the weather is hot outside, not sure there was any air-conditioning. Because the cost was reasonable, we might stay here again but would look into other options.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - quality on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Granny-Mae
Reviews.Content: Determined to stay downtown amongst the trendy cafes and pubs this ticked all the boxes. Just 3 years old, this boutique accommodation suited us fine as we spent little time in our room. The staff generously gave us early access when we arrived at 8 am when we had expected to just drop cases and wander for several hours, so we were able to catch some sleep. Yes the room is small but big enough for a desk and extra comfy chair. No wifi but free online access if you have your own plug or there's 3 free to use computers in the foyer area. We had good sleep except for the Sat night when the usual noises of a city pervade your sleep. Walk to space needle area, the waterfront and not that much of a walk to the commercial area or Pike markets. There's alway the free 99 bus that runs down 1sy Ave if you don't enjoy a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: alaskaberrys
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Belltown Inn were great! Location was great! Staff helped us out the day before our reservation with all the tips and insights to the Belltown area of Seattle and making luggage storage available to us. The room was great - courtyard room was quieter than the street-side rooms (the Belltown area is not a quiet area of Seattle). Staff and room literature explained very thoroughly what was available and whether surcharges applied. Location is close to many sights and combined with Seattle's very good transit system (google maps needs to update bus numbers). Buses and light rail made going everywhere quick and easy (which is good, as there seems to be about only four taxi's in Seattle....) For the price we paid this was a great value and would highly recommend it to any folks looking for a quality mid range hotel stay. Great view from the roof top.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location - but no WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Svart1
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here in March. Helpfull staff and good location in Belltown with many good restaurants in the close vicinity - be sure to check out good local food and drink at 360 Local. I like the complementary bicycles, although I didn't use them since it was raining so mutch. The only major negative thing about this hotel is that there is no Wifi (but you can use wired internet in the business center).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely, positively fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SouthernBelle2301
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for nearly 3 months when my employer transferred me to their corp HQ, it was a second home to me.The room was clean, comfy & within easy walking distance to downtown, Space Needle, Pike Place, waterfront. As a woman alone, I never once felt unsafe. Staff & management are EXCELLENT. They're warm, friendly, greet you by name, and are very helpful & responsive to every request. I would recommend it HIGHLY to anyone who is looking for a quality, reasonably priced stay in Seattle. Thank You "Bell"town Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfy rooms- great for a quick stay- friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: steph2630
Reviews.Content: Myself & 3 friends came here for one night from Vancouver to go to a Seahawks game. Staff were friendly and everything went very smoothly. The only annoying thing at check in /out is the inconvenient place for parking. You have to drive two blocks and go down a creepy alley and the parking spots were SO SMALL we feared hitting another car. Its in a pretty convenient location as well, easy to get a cab or bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cimbom33
Reviews.Content: It was not just a hotel but the second home to me. Great location, modern and clean rooms. Moreover, great staff. "Friendly' is not enough to tell how nice they were.Don't think twice. It is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for long term!”
Reviews.Author: Ted C
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for a year and a half. Mainly for the location and is also fair priced. The staff here is excellent. If you ever have a question they are always glad to help. I recommend this place if you are just visiting or planning on staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to be if walking around Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: C T
Reviews.Content: This place was super convenient. We went with our 1 and a half year old so we were a little skeptical about the area but turned out to be not as bad as others had said (I tend to stay out of dark alleys regardless of where I am anyway!!). Staff was very helpful and pleasant during our stay and the room was always very clean. The best part was that we could walk to all the major downtown attractions or catch a variety of buses out front. We drove there, parked the car and spent the rest of the weekend seeing everything without the hassle of tiring hikes or frustrating parking. I'll be back there on my next trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, horrible staff!”
Reviews.Author: H0nestReviewsAlways
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belltown Inn for two months or so. Its location is centralized and is a great place to stay if you really want to be in the middle of all the main attractions of Seattle. Almost all the essentials you'll need on a daily basis are within walking distance. The rooms were a bit small but not that bad and housekeeping was a 7/10 I'd say. And for some reason, internet was really expensive there! Our main issue had to do with the staff, they were really rude and didn't even greet us (nor respond when we did!) on our way in and/or out! The only exceptions to the rule were the manager and Cesar, Jeff and Rachel. I won't name the worst ones but I am sure they know themselves ... basically, if you weren't someone they can flirt with, they'd treat you like garbage! I never saw a hotel where they'd ask you to come pick up your own extra towels from the front desk, never smile at you and where the employees would have inappropriate conversations about undergarments and such right there in front of a guest! EXTREMELY unprofessional, if it were up to me I'd re-train those people. Oh, and people, "Uh-huh" is NOT the customer friendly response to "Thank you"! Only one person (Rachel) would respond with "No problem" ... there's also "Sure", "Anytime" and "You're Welcome", in case you were wondering what an appropriate response would be! Honestly, we loved seattle and wouldn't mind going back there but Belltown Inn would be the last place we'd stay it, we'd rather pay a bit more and be treated with respect.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: Scott T
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a little over a month. The rooms are small, hot and noisy. They quoted me one price but charge me another $556.00. When I asked the managment about it they became very rude immediatley. Makes me think it's happend before. Also at night you can go outside and score some crack or a prostitute. I never left my room after 8PM. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: racoontraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient to walk to downtown attractions , such as museum, pike place, library, symphony hall, etc. It is also in the free bus zone, where you can actually hop on the bus for free. The bus stop is just across the street by the dog park. Went to Seattle for a JazzFest and concerts end late, walk back , alone, quite late but never encountered any situation, either on 2nd or 3rd Ave.The immediate area is not attractive and gave me a scare at first, but there were really nice restaurants and convenient stores nearby. The room was a decent size, not cramped. The little kitchen was a wonderful plus, even includes free coffee. Bed was good and clean, linens and towels clean and fresh. They gave me a room facing the courtyard which was nice and quiet. However, around 6pm a loud rattling sound boomed into my room. Happened three times, lasting 5seconds each. Then happened again early morning. The front desk does not have any idea what it is. I inspected corridor , nothing, did not sound like coming from next room or upstairs, and cleaners would not be working around that time. I finally figured out my room was near the stairwell, and maybe a guest would go downstairs and rattle banisters or rails or something, but it was really weird. Not the hotels fault, but I would remember to request room not near stairs. The front desk was really nice, knowledgeable, and pleasant. There is free wifi and use of computers by the pleasant lobby area. I would come back and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “DOWNTOWN!”
Reviews.Author: ARIZONAULI
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is ideal, but it is a bit noisy in the late and early hours! The hotel is pretty basic but the rooms were clean and came with a little kichenette which was nice. The staff was very friendly, overall it is not a bad place to stay considering price and location.

Reviews.Title: “I really don't want to let everyone know how awesome this place is”
Reviews.Author: Sally D
Reviews.Content: Wow, my BF and I were sooo thrilled with this place - super affordable, was able to get a room at the last minute on a Saturday night even though they are almost always 90% occupied, staff was friendly and helpful, free sodas, popcorn, water and coffee in our room, new sparkling white linens, fluffy pillows, comfortable mattress, super clean everywhere, everything fresh and new, no smoking, free computer room with plenty of nice computers, free bicycler loaners, free hdtv in the rooms, on the free bus line, right smack in the middle of downtown, and on and on. We loved it. We don't want it to get too popular, though, because we want to be able to get a room there at such a great rate again! Yeah, there were people on the street late on Saturday night but we closed our window and then we couldn't really hear the people. So what?! Also, the best Italian restaurant I've even been to is right around the corner on 2nd. It's called La Vita E Bella. Go there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great & helpful employees!”
Reviews.Author: injectionxx
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great deal for the price. It's obviously not the Hilton, but the rooms are nice, the staff is very nice and very helpful, and you can get a room without a credit card! Cesar helped me check in late at night and was ready to give me suggestions of places to eat later in the evening, which is huge. Not knowing Seattle at all it's great to have someone pleasant willing to help you! The free bike rental is a huge bonus for them, I've never stayed in a hotel with that feature before. I also really appreciated the complimentary pop in the fridge and the free popcorn! I think the only downside that affected me was the lack of wireless internet, but they do have a business center with a few computers so you're not completely cut off. Also, I don't drive so this doesn't bother me, but they don't have parking so finding a spot to park for the night may be difficult. But we had an all around wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Belltown”
Reviews.Author: MyStayMyOpinion
Reviews.Content: The area is dicey especially at night...no on sight parking. The hotel has no air conditioning in the rooms. When I asked the manager, his response was..."Most hotels in Seattle don't have air conditioning because we have such inclement weather most of the year"... well I suppose these were a rare few days that it was rather warm or maybe I looked like I just arrived from Mars. We had two fans brought to our room just to have some air flow going. The rooms were basic and somewhat clean... smells from other guests cooking... dicey looking guests. Would I stay here again? No...don't think so. However, I might add the nail salon a few doors down was handy.

Reviews.Title: “what a gem”
Reviews.Author: henry l
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the bell town inn in may of 2011 and we thought what a wonderful inn, from the free use of bikes and umbrellas, to the helpful and very freindly staff our room was very clean and a nice size the location is one of the best in town close to everything Seattle has to offer. So here it is oct of 2011 as we are in the process of moving to Seattle and again we stayed at the bell town inn, and again what a wonderful experience, we are going back and forth for interviews and this place always makes us feel so welcome. the best part is we take light rail from the airport to westlake and then a very short six blocks and you have arrived at the inn. I recomend this wonderful inn

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable as home”
Reviews.Author: kumi88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights. The room was well cleaned and coffee, tea,and water bottles were fulfilled in the kitchenette every day . Mostly I loved was friendly contact of apartment concierge. Nearby, there are many good restraunts of various regeons'. We usually bought food at next door market and cook them with microwave oven. Though the hotel is placed not in the downtown area,but is very calm and looks cute. We got on free ride bus during the day hours , which was so convenent to downtown . We love it.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't need to drive here, don't.”
Reviews.Author: Amy73109
Reviews.Content: This hotel was within walking distance of several places which is very nice. I figured I would park the car in the lot I assumed was close and walk to the party I was attending a few blocks away. The lot wouldnt let me pay for longer than a few hours at a time and was very expensive. I could go on and on about my bad parking experience, I will just say if you can take a taxi here that is great...cute little hotel. Otherwise choose another because the money you will save on the hotel you will pay for in parking.

Reviews.Title: “Basic service is not even there”
Reviews.Author: swedebelgium
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to give Belltown Inn a good review but they really screwed up our stay. So even if the hotel is a good value for money, nicely located, has free bikes to use, etc. they couldn't even make sure that we had a working toilet in our room. First morning we wake up, toilet is overflowing. We call downstairs and it takes them about 2 hours to finally get a maintenance guy and cleaners in to clean up the mess. By the time we get out of the hotel to go for breakfast, I tell the receptionist that it doesn't seem like the toilet is functioning properly despite the maintenance intervention so could she send the maintenance guy to have a look at it again while we're out for the day. We get back at the hotel around 7 pm and I ask if the maintenance guy has checked our toilet, the receptionist tells us that there is no request slip there, so it must have been done. Next morning, the same lovely surprise with the toilet. Basically the hotel had completely ignored the request to make sure that the toilet work was working properly and we had two ruined mornings instead of one. As I said in the beginning, I really wanted to give this hotel a good review but by the way the handled the toilet problem, they basically ruined part of our stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “There's a fountain in the courtyard.”
Reviews.Author: ajaceman
Reviews.Content: You are only five blocks from Macy's or the Space Needle - depending on your need for fancy shopping or sky high dining - when you stay at the Belltown Inn. There are good restaurants nearby, an off-leash dog park across the street, and a delightfully eclectic coffee shop (Bedlam's) just around the corner. This hotel is a beautifully restored five storey building wrapped around a central courtyard whose murmuring fountain and echoing conversation will enhance your stay and contribute to a good night's rest. Rooms are smallish but cozy with quality carpeting and furnishings with a ceiling fan in place of A/C. Bright but tastefully colored bedding, chairs and pictures add to your comfort. Staff are friendly and efficient, and they will lend you an umbrella if it is raining outside. Rooms can be rented by the day, week or month. There are laundry services, a business centre and bicycles. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liz468
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our vacation in Seattle. We stayed at the Belltown Inn and it was great! It was clean, and the staff was very friendly. The location was excellent and we could walk to everything we wanted to see. We are already talking about our next trip to Seattle, and would DEFINATELY stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Ended up being a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: zsa-zsa013
Reviews.Content: I was a little leery after reading some of the reviews, but we went for it anyway and we found the Belltown Inn to be a great value with a wonderful staff - everyone was very nice, helpful and gave good advice on the local eateries. It was nice to have the fridge, etc. The room was smallish but clean and comfortable. We were there in Sept so AC was not really an issue, but room did have a floor fan/AC unit that worked quite well for those of us that run on the hot side. We opted not to bring our laptop so the hotel's computer room was a nice perk. We read quite a bit about this hotel/area being too loud and not for single women, etc, but it's Seattle - it is a city - what do you really expect? We certainly did notice a larger than "normal" amount of younger homeless but did not experience (or see) any real problems with anyone. Use your city common sense and you'll be fine. With regards to the loudness and city noise, we heeded the previous reviews and got a room in back off the small courtyard, so noise not an issue. Overall, we enjoyed our brief stay at this "Inn".

Reviews.Title: “convenient location but...”
Reviews.Author: mapny
Reviews.Content: The Belltown is very close to transportation. The bus stops right in front of the hotel. However, there are no air conditioning and in room wifi is not free. We got the room on the fifth floor facing 2nd Ave and it is very noisy at night with traffic/ambulance/drunk people and very hot during the day (it was hot when we were there). At night, it cools down but I can't open the window due to noise. I didn't see recommendation on the courtyard room. I thought about asking for change but too lazy to pack everything. I was there for 5 nights. I think the hotel is near shelter/community center as I found a lot of homeless within vicinity. The staff was very friendly and the hotel provides a lot of amenities including bicycles but I found the city is too hilly to ride a bike. Besides the hotel is within free ride zone and the bus stop is almost in front of the hotel so I hopped on the bus if one is stopping but the hotel is very close to downtown/Pike Place Market/Wholefood Market that I ended up walking. I shopped and stocked some drinks in the fridge in the room. Kitchen includes a set of kitchen utensils/plates/knife/cutting board etc. will stay here again next time but definitely not on 5th fl.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a couple of blocks off”
Reviews.Author: trac24
Reviews.Content: The Belltown is very close to transportation. The bus stops right in front of the hotel. If you are not used to city noise - the bus stops right in front of the hotel all night long. The hotel itself was pretty nice. The biggest drawbacks were that it had no wireless internet and no air conditioning. If it is warm, you are forced to open the windows and if you have a room that faces the street, it is very loud. The staff was very friendly and helped us change to a courtyard room. That was a little quieter. Many local people we talked to said that the location was a couple of blocks over from where tourists really want to be. It is just a short walk, but there was a significant number of homeless people near the hotel and in the dog park which is across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Guest Service, Clean/Nice Room, Location not for Single Women”
Reviews.Author: M B
Reviews.Content: The service was near amazing, the rooms were very clean, updated, the kitchenette was great. You do pay for internet service in the room (ethernet cable), however, there are computers in the lobby with free printing. In walking distance of everything. We walked to Pike Place, the Waterfront, Seattle Center, even the shopping district and Convention Center. It's near restaurants and bars. We stayed at the Belltown Inn with our baby, we did not realize that it is not in a family-friendly location. We left the hotel as a group and I would not recommend this hotel to a single woman. While we were there, two women checked in and by night fall, checked out. Once it's dark, it's clear that the surrounding area is a center for drug use and selling. However, if you are with a group or a male who feels OK with this, it is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location, good front desk help, nice business center”
Reviews.Author: BenSAllentown_PA
Reviews.Content: we were looking for an affordable hotel in a convenient spot....and we found it! the hotel seems to cater to longer term travelers on business trips and students.....but worked great for us...we used the fridge...restaurants were close and good. you can walk to all the attractions....no air conditioning - but we went in September and didn't need it......

Reviews.Title: “Near it all!”
Reviews.Author: MKE_Flyer_Dan
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel that is near it all but won't break the bank, The Belltown Inn is your place. Great Euro / Art Deco feel in a neighborhood to match. Walking distance to nearly anything you want to do and more places to eat and drink at in the area than you'll have time for. Amazingly helpful and friendly staff. Oh...something they don't mention online: Free bike w/helmet and lock usage and umbrellas to borrow for free!

Reviews.Title: “Two stays at Belltown Inn recently”
Reviews.Author: PenguinInk
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights, August 30 and 31 on a trip west and one night - September 9 - on the way back home. Found the hotel to be charming and quirky, in keeping with the neighborhood. We thoroughly enjoyed our days and nights during the stay, were able to walk to Pike Place Market, great restaurants, and local shopping. The staff was knowledgeable about restaurants and totally accommodating to our requests; kudos to Courtney, Cesar, Rachel and others whose names I can't remember. The neighborhood around the hotel was filled with interesting characters, but no one ever harassed us or made us feel uncomfortable. Room was very comfortable, even though not air-conditioned. Could hear some "discussion" through the courtyard on our last night there, but it subsided pretty quickly. Definitely a place we would look to stay again; Seattle people are the best hosts!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Deena T
Reviews.Content: Really great location... walked around the market area then over to the stadium and back again after the game. Kendra was very helpfull in getting us the rooms we wanted. The whole staff was very friendly. We will stay here again. People need to understand that just as in any other big city - there are homeless people etc walking around outside. The hotel was clean & felt completely safe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value”
Reviews.Author: preedijk
Reviews.Content: We had a spacious room with a kitchenette, a desk and a clean bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Parking cost us $10,- for our two-night stay, which is more than reasonable, and use of the internet connection (wire, so no wi-fi) was $5,- per night. Best feature of the Belltown Inn is its location: easily accesible from the freeway (and airport), 15-minute walk from both Space Needle one way and Pike Place Market the other. The hotel has a rooftop deck which allows you to -just- see the Space Needle. Breakfast is not included, but there are plenty of good options for that in the direct vicinity. Would definitely recommend this hotel for a trip to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and value”
Reviews.Author: OceanMountain
Reviews.Content: What a great spot! It was walking distance to Pike Place, Seattle Center/Space Needle, and downtown. The walk is through a nice neighbourhood as well! The value here is unbeatable. The room was great:clean and functional. My only complaint is that the wi-fi was not free in the rooms. There were however three computers for use in the lobby. I recommend this place to value-conscious travellers who still want to be near the heart of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy location but staff and facilities were great”
Reviews.Author: DanC21
Reviews.Content: I knew there was no A/C in this hotel, but it was about 85 degrees the 3 days I was in Seattle. My window faced the busy 3rd Ave, so during the day it was quite noisy, but at night it wasn't too bad. Room was very clean, staff was friendly and informative. Don't worry about the neighborhood, just be vigilant as you should be in any city. Great location in relation to transit, restaurants, Space Needle, downtown, & waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: wong5058
Reviews.Content: Just came back from an overnight stay to Seattle. The location of this hotel was located in just the perfect spot for access to virtually all the popular tourist attractions. We were able to walk to the Pike Street Market and the Space Needle. They are right on the edge of the free Metro bus zone, where we were able to access many of the other Seattle attractions including Pioneer Square area and Chinatown. We were also able to take the free buses back to the King Street Amtrak station, to return home. Lack of air conditioning, but had extra fans in the rooms, so it wasn't so bad for us. In the evenings, we bought a bottle of wine and enjoyed it on their rooftop deck. There were free bikes available for guest use and had a business center with many computers for us to use, at no charge. If you want, you can get internet access, for your room, for $5.00 per night, but we didn't find it necessary. Matt, at the front desk was fantastic and gave us great suggestions for things to do and visit. The rooms were sufficient, as were the facilities and amenities. We had a wonderful, car free, two day visit to Seattle and a large part of it was due to the experiences of this hotel. Would stay here again without a second thought!!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, good value”
Reviews.Author: StephenJill
Reviews.Content: Located about 5 blocks from main shopping district, serviced by a free bus along Third Ave. Our rooms got the late afternoon sun and were very hot. There is no air con but a large central ceiling fan helped. We were assured that it only happpened like that for a short time in mid summer. It was also close to the Victoria Clipper wharf where the ferry to Victoria leaves from. Staff were very courteous and went out of their way to help

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time and great service”
Reviews.Author: Maggie S
Reviews.Content: We were just at the hotel for the labour day long weekend. The room was clean, comfortable and presentable. The hotel staff were amazing, absolutely fantastic customer service. Andrea at the front desk was the highlight, she was fun and knowledgeable and super friendly. I had read that the area wasn't the greatest, but we didn't mind it at all, and had no problems, no one asked us for money, etc. The restaurant and bars close to the hotel are fun and the hotel is quiet enough. We really liked that our room had a fridge and microwave, along with free popcorn, pop and water. (I LOVED the popcorn, what a great touch!) The bathroom was clean and the rooms always smelled awesome when we returned from our day. Our only couple of complaints - the bed was hard and sort of uncomfortable, but it was all right, we didn't expect luxury. There is no air conditioning in the hotel, and it was between 25C and 30C the entire weekend. Luckily, our room didn't face the street and we were able to have our windows open the entire time. The room did have a ceiling fan and small portable fan, which helped. I would suggest providing a larger fan for the room, as the small fan was, well, small!

Reviews.Title: “Great central downtown location at a good price!”
Reviews.Author: maestralori
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for Labor Day weekend. The pluses: Nice lobby, clean & nicely decorated rooms, awesome location for walking to Pike Place Market, Space Needle, lots of restaurants, & waterfront. Nice kitchenette & hotel even throws in a few beverages in the fridge for free! The downside: no A/C. It was in the high 70's (if not 80) this weekend, and my room felt like a sweltering sauna, even with ceiling fan & floor fan! I'm very tolerant to heat living in Calif, but come on! My window did face the west with the sun beating on it, so maybe it's better facing the east? Other times of year, it's probably fine with the cool rainy weather. Also, it was VERY loud at night until 3am with party people yelling on the street. I had to put earplugs in & still hard to sleep. Maybe that's better on a non-weekend night? Would I stay here again? Only if they get A/C or during non-summer weather. It's a very cute little place & would've rated higher with A/C.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here and would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: damagedsiren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belltown Inn for 1 week. The staff especially Matthew and Patrick were great. They gave us great recommendations on places to eat and things to see. The hotel is close to everything, including great places to eat. I can not say enough good things about Matthew and Patrick, very helpful with directions and anything else that we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: TrishGo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Belltown Inn on 2 separate occasions and highly recommend it for younger, active travellers. The neighborhood is very busy at night, and there are many ambulances that go by due to the area. I definitely felt safe walking around with peers even though there were some sketchy people out and about at night. It is really close to many bars and lounges (I really liked List and Black Bottle). I also walked to the Space Needle and to the ferry terminal to take the Clipper to the Butchart Gardens. There is no need for a car since it is on the free bus route so it's easy to go to downtown and to the stadiums. Took the Downtown Airporter from the airport to the last stop which drops you off a few blocks from the hotel. This hotel is very reasonably priced, especially if you are travelling with friends and need a room with two queen beds. The room is clean, not very big but that didn't matter to me since I didn't go to Seattle to hang out in a hotel room. The provide some drinks in the room fridge and some snacks. They also provide a microwave. We bought a bottle of wine from the little store across the street and borrowed an opener and drank on the roof. The hotel staff is awesome. We went to them for a list of recommended restaurants and bars, and they cater it to your tastes/styles. There is a business center and they permit free prints (page limit) which is perfect for when you check in to your flight and want to print your boarding pass. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fine if you can put up with dealers, prostitutes and a dog park.....”
Reviews.Author: Lizc365
Reviews.Content: Not good from the start I'm afraid, for those that know it there is a character in Little Britain "computer says No" that was our welcome on the Sunday - maybe she didn't want to be in work? No help with parking despite being told in advance that there was off street parking "No space, ask tomorrow, you can pay outside tonight and hope to get a space tomorrow" Once a police officer arrived outside to help us things changed somewhat..the officer had to rush off though as there was a deal taking place across the road....thus started our stay in Seattle The room was clean but small, bed comfortable. However we were opposite a dog park (yes a park dedicated to doggie fun..paddling pool the lot!!) so that was very noisy early in the morning - people taking their dogs there before leaving for work I guess? Public transport was excellent, walk too far to main part of town really but good bars and restaurants 5 minutes away if you can put up with the tramps, beggars, dealers, prositutes....i just couldn't- hated every minute of it. I felt unsafe there the whole time - and I live in London, not a quiet village somewhere. Such a shame, I was so looking forward to Seattle, but never again. We were told that they were trying to "upmarket the area" hope it happens, but the area was unpleasant and the photographs of the hotel didn't quite add up to what we saw.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here in hot weather”
Reviews.Author: TOKEEN
Reviews.Content: Have previously stayed at this hotel and think it is great for price and location but this stay was during hot weather in Seattle (85') and it was impossible to cool the room down. This made it hard to sleep. It was cooler in the lobby and outside.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay in this hotel in the summer.”
Reviews.Author: maria g
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not that bad for the price we booked it, it is clean, the personal is friendly. There is about 15 min walking distance to the down town. But the big disadvantage of this place is that there is no air conditioner in the room. We found 2 fans working there but we could not open the windows because they were looking to the very noisy, busy street. The weather outside was about 80 F and it was even higher in the room at the time we were returning to the hotel in the evening. There were many homeless people around and I did not feel safe when it was dark. There is no even continental breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, calmed my worries!”
Reviews.Author: jenmal1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Belltown in on more than one occasion, and the location, rooms, and staff are great! The room are clean and the rates when purchased in advance, are pretty good for the area. There is a bit of street noise when you are on the 3rd ave side, so if this is an issue, I recommend you request a garden side room. I like the street noise, it's part of Seattle. The have bikes you can rent, a business center for internet, but do not provide this in the rooms which is a bummer, but there is a great coffee shop on Second just a block away with free WiFi. I wish they would provide it for the price point! Overall it's a decent place to stay in Belltown, and don't let the street people scare you away, they are harmless and only in the area because there is a place that helps them out nearby! I did have a potential a worry with my payment method and the site, but after mentioning this to the staff via e-mail, the GM contacted me personally and made me feel more confident that the site and staff were secure. I will definitely stay here again, as I always do!

Reviews.Title: “Edge of Belltown is an ideal spot”
Reviews.Author: melKirdasi
Reviews.Content: Quirky area, but this adds character. Belltown has the best places to eat & drink away from the standard tourist area. You have a five minute walk to the water front,ten to Pikes, & ten to the Needle. Weekends are noisy but weeknights not so much. I had my windows open for the cooling air.The Inn is simple & clean. The small kitchen setup in the rooms allows you to bring fresh produce & meats for your own prep. Pet friendly first floor & dog park across the street for pet lovers. Complimentary bikes on loan in the courtyard. The location is central to everything you will be seeing & the free bus route loop stops right beside the inn.The bed was a queen, but was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and value”
Reviews.Author: EnjoytheJourney
Reviews.Content: About 5 blocks from Space Needle. Within a few minutes walking to all downtown sights. Right on 3rd St. where many buses pass to go to many areas of the city. Bikes available for free! New computers and free Internet available. Very nicely renovated. Extremely clean. Microwave, min fridge and sink in room. Super friendly staff. I looked a lot and could not find a better value. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and interesting”
Reviews.Author: Sarah C
Reviews.Content: The staff was nice and helpful but like stated before the neighborhood was a little different from what I am use to. We were two young girls traveling together and we didn't feel comfortable being out and about after dark. Be prepared for homeless people and panhandlers. I did notice the police would patrol a lot, which helped the situation. I don't believe I will stay in this part of the city again.

Reviews.Title: “Too small and warm”
Reviews.Author: DrAmazon13
Reviews.Content: Location great, walking distance to Pike's Place Market and loads of restaurants. Room was small, but had microwave and fridge. Worst part was the air does NOT get cold enough. Had to open the windows and then it was load with nighttime city noises and cars. Beds way too hard also. Hardly slept.

Reviews.Title: “excellent friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: tufnellparkandy
Reviews.Content: This really was a great find: fantastically friendly staff and incredibly cheap rates for good quality accommodation. There's a really lovely roof terrace with views of the city, Space Needle and the Puget Sound. Perfect to grab a beer at sunset. Belltown is a great location, although deserves it's slighly edgy rap after midnight. Don't let it put you off though. A really high standard for the price bracket.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, GREAT staff”
Reviews.Author: Txtravels76
Reviews.Content: I say the hotel was ok, because the room was a little small, and the "view" was of an empty/abandoned lot. The neighborhood was very "colorful" and interesting. The reason I rated this hotel so high, was because of the service. Every employee we interacted with was super helpful and knowledgeable. I don't think I would stay there again, but only because the neighborhood was a little too colorful for us. But, if you don't mind that kind of thing, then it is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good surprise!”
Reviews.Author: flowershopgirl
Reviews.Content: We found this online a month prior, other hotels were booked. We had two nights. Good price. Location was great! At first I was worried it would be in a seedier part of downtown. As Seattle has many homeless unfortunately, this area is no different. But the location is very close to shops, train (light rail from Seatac and monorail to Space Needle), Pike Place market, piers, and places of interest. Lots of good restaurants nearby, especially great Sushi. Bars, coffee shops galore. We did not have a car, but there is some parking around, but we were worried and so had returned the rental car. Didn't need it. Walked everywhere from hotel and stopped back for a break in midday. Clean and comfy bed, small kitchenette with complimentary water and soda. As it was July it could get warm in room, but liked window open and fan on, also had extra fan, good for white noise. Since the area can be noisy at night on weekends, we chose a room overlooking the courtyard. Business area in lobby with several PCs. They ordered our taxi and held our luggage when we got there early on arrival day. Nice views from the roof. No restaurant or pool, this is a smaller hotel with 5 floors. It really was a nice surprise and especially for the money. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better.”
Reviews.Author: Granny1954
Reviews.Content: Perfect is the word that comes to mind. Location was maybe not in the safest neighborhood, but we encountered no problems. Perfect place to stay for the day before a cruise. We were able to walk to all the tourist spots: space needle, public market, etc. Great restaurants close by. Staff members were so friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend to anyone needing a place to stay before a cruise. Had to take a cab to the pier but not expensive from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: dylancasb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean. I have stayed in many "fancier" hotels but have never seen such an active cleaning crew. Anyone who complains that the hotel is in a bad area has never spent much time in big cities, especially in the East. There are some nutty people walking around, but definitely not dangerous. I rented a car for a few days and did not have issues with parking, however, I only parked in the area at night and left the area in the morning. Lots of good restaurants and bars just down the block. Got a reduced weekly rate. All around good value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: pologal75
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend over the Fourth of July weekend. Neither one of us had ever been and just booked this hotel as a package deal. It was a perfect location to everything. We walked everywhere. It felt like no matter where we went it was no more than a ten minute walk. The hotel staff was so accommodating and helped us with anything we needed. They recommended great places to eat and see. They have free bikes you can rent to tour the city that includes a bike lock and a helmet. It is a hotel for a more younger crowd. I wouldn't necessarily want to take my family there. There was just a younger crowd. I highly recommend this place to anyone that was an affordable and comfortable hotel in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Urban gem in Belltown”
Reviews.Author: LibraryPeg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Belltown Inn on a recent visit to our favorite city. The location is great, walking distance to downtown, Pike Place and Seattle Center. Top Pot Donuts is a couple of blocks away, and the desk staff clued us in to a little local gastropub down the street that was excellent. The bus stops at 3rd and Bell and 4th and Blanchard have buses that go anywhere one could possibly want to go (even the Zombie Walk in Fremont). We didn't need a car, we just got ORCA cards at the airport and rode the buses everywhere, or walked. The reservations people were very helpful and patient as we dithered about out arrival date, having planned to take the Empire Builder out to Seattle, we were forced to make changes in our plans at more or less the last minute when the trains were canceled. But they were able to add a couple nights to our stay with no problems. The room was adequate, comfortable if a little spare. I basically had two (small) issues--we were a little surprised (probably because I neglected to doublecheck this myself) to find that Internet access was via modem and ethernet cable at (a small) extra cost (No free Wifi! In Seattle! Really!). And I would personally not call a mini fridge, microwave and a hotplate (with only one working burner) a "kitchenette". But we weren't using the room as temporary housing (like some people do) and it was very nice for a week's vacation stay. One thing, though--if you are not used to an urban environment--if homeless people and street people hanging around in a neighborhood is disconcerting, or if the normal night noises of a city neighborhood disturb your sleep (as apparently they did for one other guest we heard complaining about it to the front desk), then you would be better off in an airport hotel or a downtown corporate chain hotel. We were fine, I didn't see anything out of the ordinary, but we're from Chicago. Suburbanites might want to make a different choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: pajervis
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel and the staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. They were able to advise me on all sorts of things and gave me maps, printed off walking directions, and told me where to get a quick bite at the end of a long day. The room was very roomy for my 2 sons and I and had a refrigerator in it. The bathroom was very up to date and everything was very clean. The location couldn't have been better--seemed like we were walking distance to everything. My only complaint was that our room was on the second floor facing the corner and it was very bright (lights) and very loud. I am sure if we had asked to switch rooms, we could have alleviated that but I wasn't willing to move the boys during the night. I would definitely stay here again but I'd ask for a room in the back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiwigirl59
Reviews.Content: I wasn't planning on writing a review for this hotel, because it's so good that I didn't want it to be full when I came back to Seatle. It was going to be my "go to" place, next time I visited Seattle. However after suffering sexual abuse and public humiliation at the hands of the TSA at SeaTac on my departure, I will never go back to Seattle again. That's a pity, because I loved Seattle. Anyway, the Belltown Inn is great. I love the location. Shops, buses, restaurants, eveything you could wish for is right there. The service was terrific, they were all so nice and helpful. And my room was very quiet. It overlooked the courtyard and had double-glazing. And it was spotless. Housekeeping are doing a great job. There were some problems with the lift, but hopefully that has been sorted out by now. The guy trying to fix it, was clueless, I suggest they try a different company. All in all, it's a great hotel and if common sense was to ever prevail with the TSA (which I doubt), I would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: Danziger2
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay, with friendly, helpful staff, and super clean, comfortable and convenient rooms. It was my first time to Seattle, so I wasn't prepared for the prevalence of homeless people and some, sorry, weird street types found in the area near the hotel. So, walking there from the train station, I thought I had made a bad choice, that I would crash that night, and find new digs after. But, once I got there, it was just great, and once I understood the aforementioned situation and that it was nothing to be worried about (and the fact that if you just go a block in the other direction there's all kinds of great bars and restaurants, and nary a street person to be seen), all was cool. The staff were great, helping me navigate the city, public transport, etc., and the room was great, with its own kitchenette, fridge, etc., which was great for keeping food expenses down. It was a great stay, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again if I return to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ashzoolbud13
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here 1 night...flew in to see a baseball game, and we were plesantly surprised!! The Belltown Inn was much cheaper than most of the other local hotels, and was in a GREAT location. We walked to the Space Needle, and walked down to Pikes Market. The bus stop was only a minute away, and took us right to the game. The rooms are just your typical room, nothing fancy...but they do have a little kitchenette, with free popcorn, soda & water in the rooms! The staff at the front desk is incredibly nice, and very accomodating, especially Susan. I will DEFINITELY stay here next time i'm in town, and would highly reccomend it. :)

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Aliciabauer3232
Reviews.Content: I'm convinced that the staff working here wrote the reviews on here. There is nothing positive about this place. I have only been here for 4 nights and can't wait to leave! I will be looking for a new place to stay this upcoming weekend. The rooms are small, smell like urine and dirty diapers, horrible bed, sheets and towels and lastly you can't sleep at night!! I'm writing this as I listen to a couple screaming at 2:30 am! This is worse than a college dorm, not to mention the most transient and drug infested street corner in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Character,Comfy, Clean, Cheap...”
Reviews.Author: dino017
Reviews.Content: GREAT value! In the heart of an eclectic neighborhood. Close to the dynamic city center. Surrounded by bus lines, subway, sky train. and rental car companies and they will lend you a bicycle if you want! Lots of good food at good prices close by. Maintained and clean property. The staff left me wanting nothing. Safe and secure. The business center and knowledgeable staff was of great service. I stayed one month, my dog travels with me. By the way, FREE loaner umbrella's. When I go back to Seattle, I stay at only one place --- The Belltown Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Free bicycles made my stay”
Reviews.Author: drnorth
Reviews.Content: There's nothing wrong with this hotel. It isn't fancy, the rooms are small and the beds aren't very plush, but the location is a good one (if you want to be in Belltown, which i did) and the price is pretty good. (I say "Pretty Good" because for not very much more money i could have stayed at a 4 star downtown if i booked through one of the online booking services.) The staff were great - super helpful and friendly. I initially thought to myself that i would rather shell out a bit more money to stay at a fancier hotel, but I warmed up to the Belltown Inn. Sure, the bed was so-so, the tv was small and my room looked out at another wall, but my room also had some free snacks and beverages, a microwave in its kitchenette, and free bicycles. Seriously, the hotel has free bicycles (and locks and helmets) for use by the guests. The front desk people pointed me in the direction of a lovely bike trail along the sea and i had a wonderful sunday morning ride. That is a pretty good perk. I hadn't planned to rent a bike and probably wouldn't have spent the money to do so, but being able to go on a hassle-free ride, but splendid and the best part of my stay, So, it's not fancy, but it is affordable and full of pleasant surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great price.”
Reviews.Author: 2011chevre
Reviews.Content: The staff and the location of this hotel are excellent. Matthew at the front desk gave us some great tips and fabulous dining recommendations. My husband and I stayed for 3 nights and it was perfect for the price. We were able to walk everywhere and felt very safe here. The only downside is that if you get a room on 3rd Ave it will be very very noisy. They even have earplugs at the front desk but this only minimally helps. I would suggest calling before your stay to see if you can get a courtyard room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place in to Stay in Seattle Down Town”
Reviews.Author: pskarnawal
Reviews.Content: i stayed in bell town arround 7 months. It is really a great place in Down town.The room services and security is very good. Easy to reach and all the facilities like kitchen, laundry, local phones, internet are provided by belltown. Restaurents and grocery shops are very near including convence(bus service). All the staff including Pattrick, Sujain are very helpful. I do recommend to enjoy by staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: KlamathFallsYoly
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Seattle and as I mostly travel alone, wanted a hotel that was in a safe area and within walking distance of the Pike Marketplace and restaurants. My initial plans changed so I found myself in Seattle at 7AM on Sunday morning with nowhere to go. The hotel staff was very accomodating and let me check in early. My first impression when I saw the was not great because there appeared to be so many homeless people hanging around. The hotel itself is small but has a nice little lobby and an enclosed free wireless area. The room was clean and a nice size with a small kitchenette. There is no free wireless in the room, though, but for a small fee, the hotel will provide a high speed modem. The area, it turned out, was great! It was within walking distance of just about everything and I felt quite safe the entire time. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Overall, I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit noisy on a night!”
Reviews.Author: jenbro85
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was small but comfortable. Great location for getting to Pike Place Market and the Space Needle. We would recommend the 'Ride the Ducks' tour which goes from near the Space Needle and we found a great bar called 'Athenians' in the market which has a happy hour on food and drink! If you want to go to the top of the Space Needle, book lunch - it's a set menu for $25 and includes the lift ride (which otherwise is about $18).

Reviews.Title: “greatly disappointed. Rude service and loud neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaRogers
Reviews.Content: Walking into the lobby i was not greeted by the receptionist kindly. She gave me dirty looks and after checking me in didn't even tell me how to get to my room. After I asked her the way she rolled her eyes and pointed in the direction i needed to go. My room was very small. We got back to the room at 10pm and while trying to sleep around 11pm people were on the roof being very loud. We went to the front desk to ask if they would take care of the yelling on the roof and the same wonderful receptionist said no. So i got to sleep with the t.v on to drown out the noise. However the new woman at the front desk that checked me out was very nice and apologized for the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Varietal
Reviews.Content: Belltown Inn is handy to lotsa restaurants and transport as well as being within easy walking distance to both Space Needle and Pike Place - 'bout midway between them. The kitchenette and laundry facilities were very conveniet and helped keep costs down. Great grocerey store less than a block away and open 'til late at nite. Dawn and dusk views from the roof were fab! We had outside room with it's warned-about street noises, but nothing that bothered us. The lack of air cond would make this uncomfortable on warm days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DandKtravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was with in a 15 min walk from the Grey Hound Station, Easy to Find, The front desk staff were nice and answered any questions we had about eating, They recomended Mama's Mexician Kitchen around the corner, They had great happy hr specials. Also within walking distance to the space needle & market. The room was spotless and smelled clean, enjoyed the comp pop corn and pop, had a fridge/microwave. Nice touch was the roof top access with the chairs & complimantary bikes that you get to sign out. The only downsides were small bathroom (but i was there to site see not hang out in the room) & no Air Conditing but there was a fan in the room, did not find the area nosy.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! This hotel was perfect for the price and location!”
Reviews.Author: blackeyesusans
Reviews.Content: Accommodations were great; staff was well informed of the area/attractions/great places to eat, etc; location was perfect. We were able to walk to everything--Pike's Place Market, the location used for "Seattle Grace Hospital" on Grey's Anantomy; the Science Center, Seattle Aquarium, The Space Needle, our cruise ship port...could NOT have asked for a better place to rest our heads. We even walked to the hotel from the Seattle Light Rail station from Sea-Tac Airport. TERRIFIC!! The only drawback was -- this hotel is located on a very busy street with lots of traffic and sirens/emergency traffic at ALL hours of the night and day. Pack your earplugs IF you're a light sleeper!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a Good location”
Reviews.Author: warden07
Reviews.Content: Hotel was easy to find and the location to all amenities was very good. We did not have to use our car to go any where. Walking distance to Safeco field.The market,space needle and lots of shopping. We would stay again. Staff were very helpful. Rooms were very clean and quite. Nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alybyzrp
Reviews.Content: We weren't overly familiar with the Seattle area before our trip and choose the Belltown Inn based on cost and TA reviews. The hotel was in a great location - walkable to the Space Needle and Pike's Place Market, as well as many great restaurants and bars. The hotel room itself was clean and comfortable. We'd stay here if in the area again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gail_2616
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at the Belltown Inn while visiting family and touring around downtown Seattle. The Inn is very well-located being at one end of the "free ride" zone for public transport. If you are into walking, Pike Place Market is 15 minutes, the Space Needle only 10. The rooms are very clean, the reception friendly and helpful, and parking is across the street for $10 a day (24 hours) - a great deal for Seattle. The Inn has bikes (with helmets and locks) that may be borrowed and a deck on the roof. The only drawback was no internet in the rooms, although there is a business centre on the main floor offering computer access. The area around the hotel can be rather noisy in the evenings, but that also means that restaurants and bars are nearby. A great place to stay for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Minala
Reviews.Content: The Inn includes nightly hotel guests as well as longer term residents. Rooms include small kitchen area (microwave, refrigerator and coffeepot). No utensils and dinnerware. This is great as there are many markets close by including Ralphs Market and Deli (4th Ave) where you can stock up on groceries. There is a small deli and cafe next door to the Inn as well as many restaurants in the vicinity. Staff are very helpful. Bike rentals (with helmets) are available at no charge along with free internet service in the business center. The Inn is within walking distance to all Seattle locations. Bus stop located outside front door. Light rail station to airport within a few walkable blocks. The Inn does not have fitness facilities but there is a 24 Hour Fitness located about 10 mins away. I stayed in a room facing the inner court. Nice and quiet. Clean and safe accomodations. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Peachlett
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel to anyone seeking to stay in the Belltown area. The staff is very helpful, pleasant,and willing to hold your bags after checkout. While not particularly posh, the roof top patio affords a view of downtown, the waterfront, and a good part of the Space Needle. The Belltown Inn is within easy walking distance of the Pike Street Market, the Westlake LINK station and is within the "free" bus zone. I did find that outdoor sounds were audible through the windows, but I always travel with ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Service, location and kindness”
Reviews.Author: MarioDario
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel using tripadvisor, and I am very happy about it: very good location (near city center, restaurants and nighlife), front desk very kind and helpful, room cleen and confortable, great service (free internet with 3/4 pc and free print, free bike). The only defect is about location, very central end easy to arrive but not so beautiful as a place and frequentation (that part of 3rd ave). I think also the price was quite good, especially during working days

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel, handy for everything”
Reviews.Author: LizzieT1
Reviews.Content: Very friendly desk staff, good-sized room with the bonus of a kitchenette (with popcorn and microwave supplied). Stayed in an inside room so cannot comment on any street noise, the hotel itself seemed very quiet. As others have commented the immediate area is not the best, however did not feel at risk wandering around in the evening (I'm used to London though, so if you come from a small town you will feel uneasy). Once you are a couple of blocks away you are in the middle of the restaurants/bars anyway. Great location, easy walk to the pike market and space needle, convenience store opposite with the essentials. Free internet at reception and bikes to borrow too!

Reviews.Title: “contrast to Seattle Sprit”
Reviews.Author: evergreen55711
Reviews.Content: Aloof and cold staffs that is in contrast with nice weather in Seattle during May. One staff brough family member and boy friend to work, using guest computer room and not attendatitive to customers.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you are there to party.”
Reviews.Author: kcwildcat35
Reviews.Content: Earlier in the week we stayed at the Mediterranean Inn, and that stay was much better. We checked in at the Belltown on a Friday evening surrounded by a bunch of drunk young kids and crackhead homeless people right outside the hotel. There is a street of bars one block over that they all were going to. Once again our room had no A/C, and we could not leave the window open because of the drunks and bums yelling and motorcycles driving by. The bed was the worst hotel bed I have ever slept on. Lumpy old miniature pillows, sand paper sheets, and a small flat bed. The one positive is that it is inside the RIDE FREE ZONE for the buses.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Clean, & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: KOrlando
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belltown last year for about 4 nights. Rooms are small but very clean. We had to open the windows at night to get some air but we were never hot (we're from new orleans, so 60 degree weather is wonderful) The staff at the front desk were super nice & very helpful w/any questions that we had. The roof top has a nice view of the city and the space needle. Belltown is also within walking distance to Pike Place Market and many restaurants. Felt safe walking around this area--day or night. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: pvexplorer
Reviews.Content: The Upsides: The Belltown Inn is 6 blocks from Seattle Center and 6 blocks from Pike's Place Market. The free downtown bus stops in front of the building. Wonderful restauants (like Shiro's) are just a short walk. There is a nice roof-top deck to enjoy with a glass of wine. There are lots of night spots in this neighborhood. The staff is friendly and accomodating and the price is terrific. You might be able to get a better deal if you call them directly: I did. The downsides: Belltown is a VERY noisy neighborhood. The hotel has no air conditioning but they give you a fan and there is also a very effective ceiling fan in the room. The noise makes it impossible to keep the window open. Ask for a room facing the courtyard. Our room faced the west and you have a partial view of the water but the noise of the neighborhood revelers goes on all night. On the weekend the police apparently use the vacant lot to the west of the building as a staging area. There was a huge police RV with spotlights and 6 police cars parked there. The hotel could benefit from some black-out curtains over the blinds to help with the noise and the lights in the neighborhood. They keep the dryers at the front desk. Parking is available for an extra charge; the lot is down the block. The rooms are on the small side but very clean and everything is new. The bottom line: We found it more than adequate and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect In-town Location”
Reviews.Author: 1oldseagull
Reviews.Content: We were surprised by the number of semi-permanent residents in Belltown Inn - young, just-out-of-school types - but nice. For two old love-birds like us, this in-town living was exciting! Location was great for walking to all the sights - Pike's Place, the ferry to Bainbridge Island. I reserved through TravelHero and upon check-in found that parking was extra, though i am certain it was included. $10 a day, I paid it. Overall, price for the location was good. Room faced into courtyard - very nicely appointed - WiFi in dedicated room off of lobby - your computer or theirs - wired connection in rooms. NO SMOKE HOTEL :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: GPappa
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to everything in down town Seattle. The bus - free in this area when headed down town is a plus. The staff is very friendly and willing to help with any question. We stayed in a 2nd floor room facing the courtyard during midweek. The room was cozy but very clean. We had an experience with bed bugs on our last trip (Austin, TX) so we inspected the bedding and found that this hotel uses protective coverings on the box springs and mattress - plus. Room has no A/C but a celing fan and they have fans available if more ventillation needed.

Reviews.Title: “If it was in Europe, it would be 3+ stars!”
Reviews.Author: COG71
Reviews.Content: It is central to downtown - just walk south on 2nd or 1st Ave, 3rd has very little to see/do (and is not recommended late at night), but there is a bus stop right there, and downtown buses are free. We had a courtyard room, so got a good night's sleep all three nights of our stay. The room was a normal size; the kitchenette was a great way to keep costs down on breakfast as well as to save treats and doggie bags (Seattle has some awesome restaurants, often with large portions). The staff was astonishingly helpful - even in deciphering the public transit system for us. The Inn also offers bikes/helmets/locks on loan (which we rode to Ballard and Fremont on nearby bike paths), and it has a "business center" complete with internet and printer. In short - the Belltown Inn had more amenities than my home, and at an unbeatable price. I would definitely return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: shwagirl46
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belltown Inn for 3 nights (June 28th-July1st, 2010). It is quite a nice little place to stay. Very clean and the staff were always eager to help with your inquiries. It is really close to anything you want to do downtown Seattle. Short walk to Pike's Market and Aquarium and also to the Needle and Downtown Shopping. Lots of nice restaurants close by as well as a convenience store just across the road. The kitchenette was great to have since we like a light breakfast with lots of fresh fruit which we picked up at the market our first day. It also allowed us to pack a lunch for our touring around and our flight home. If we ever get back to Seattle, we would stay there again. Judy & Paul Davidson, Oshawa, Ontario

Reviews.Title: “After Two Months here it has an been one of the best deals that I have come across in all of my years of travel”
Reviews.Author: toddnaples1
Reviews.Content: Well this is the beginning of my third month staying at the Bell Town Inn,In Down Town Seattle,And They have gone out of there way to Help me with so many different things that I cannot begin to describe how important that is when a man comes all the way across the United States and Is away from his family and loved ones,And to have a staff that treats you with a sort of kindness ,that means so much,the hospitality is so sincere and accomidating, If you want a place that is safe and secure With the neighborhood being well policed,That I personally recommended this place to all of the people that are affiliated with the international bricklayers and allied craftsworkers union,As well as anybody that really wants to get an exceptional deal,You will not find a better Deal anywhere ,And the reason that I know that is, After all the research that I have done, To put Quite simply does not exist,I have a short walk to the Famous pike place market,And that is priceless all in it self with never having to get in to a cab or vehicle,If you want to be in the heart of the city ,And get the most bang for your Buck, And after two months I think that gives me a good idea as to what kind of place it is,And with that being said, That I highly Recommend That you Stay at the Bell Town Inn,In Downtown Seattle,sincerely Todd Naples''Michigan''

Reviews.Title: “It was Okay”
Reviews.Author: remsonia
Reviews.Content: Positives: Walkable -- close to downtown and Pike Place, very central bus location. There are lots of great restaurants and bars. You do not have to take your vehicle to get to main attractions. Nice business center. A diversified neighborhood, it has great characters. This neighborhood is in the process of gentrification. There are still some dilapidated buildings and unattractive graffiti mixed with new higher end apartments. Negatives: Bad ventilation (smells like ramen noodles all the time!), and staff were apathetic. Heating was difficult to manipulate. We had a window that faced into an adjacent room, and you could see your neighbors. There was only one elevator. BIG problem -- NO parking for guests. Parking is super expensive in Seattle's downtown!!!!!!!!! If you were to stay longer with a vehicle, there is no long term parking nearby!!!!! The description of the suite stated there was full kitchen when they didn't have utensils or plates.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, But Loud Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: stephb123
Reviews.Content: The location to different tourist attractions is great for the price. However, there are many bars around this hotel and around 2:00 am when they are all closing, all the drunks come out and are very loud on the street. Unfortunately, the windows aren't well insulated and you get woken up. Also, the hotel is on the main bus line (3rd ave), so you hear the buses come and go all day and night. There seemed to be a lot of people on the street asking for money also. The hotel itself is great. Clean, fridge, microwave, free internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “More Upside Than Downside”
Reviews.Author: heutemorgan
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, great $$ value, wonderful staff, stayed here 5 nights. Withing walking distance of everything worth seeing. Area has great restaurants. One downside: Kelly's Bar at 3rd and Bell is the center of drug and alcohol life in Belltown. Lost some sleep due to noise. If I had to do it again, I would stay here one more time but ask for a room on the Elliott Bay side.

Reviews.Title: “Support this friendly, small hotel in a neighborhood on the edge of change & bursting with color!”
Reviews.Author: TessandMax
Reviews.Content: My Sweetie & I chose this inn based on our budget but would not hesitate to stay again. Our room was bright & clean & the staff was wonderful. It was our first visit to Seattle & the folks at the front desk were very helpful & knew the best places to eat (don't miss the Mac & Cheese at the Rendevous!). Even with free public transit readily available, we found the Belltown easily within walking distance of many of Seattle's best attractions. Although we didn't use the kitchenette, I'm sure it would have been useful if we would have had leftovers to store or reheat. I was a little concerned with what I read about the neighborhood, but we were not hassled by anyone. If I had to report anything negative, it would be the late-night noise in the lot next to the hotel. Once we shut the window though, didn't have any trouble sleeping. The lobby laundry services were clean & easily accessible (so you can pack lighter). Overall, a great stay & amazing value!

Reviews.Title: “Central with amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: jensparkle
Reviews.Content: The Belltown Inn was in a trendy neighbourhood close to downtown and all the tourist spots. There were amazing bars and restaurants just round the corner with the yummiest Mexican place! The Belltown Inn staff were so lovely, really chatty and always offering suggestions for where to eat and drink. The only thing was the rooms on the outside were quite noisy - so if noise bothers you, ask for a courtyard room which are much quieter. Would definitely stay again next time we're in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what service & great price!”
Reviews.Author: Twig2
Reviews.Content: We had to stay two nights because my husband had to be at Virginia Mason for surgery. Not knowing we needed an overnight, we brought our dog. We were welcomed with open arms, a clean, clean room with frig, microwave, coffee pot, sodas, popcorn AND dog park across the street. My husband stayed the first night with me and I stayed by myself the second night. I felt totally secure. PLUS an added bonus, they had computers for our internet use so I could let family know what was happening! The price was almost half of what surrounded the hospital! Our dog loved the park, I loved the park! We couldn't of asked for more!! Thanks to such a wonderful staff!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent and Insulting Staff.”
Reviews.Author: GoLoggers
Reviews.Content: haven’t ever written a negative review, but this place does not deserve to be in business. The staff is completely incompetent and insulting. Here is my story. I booked a reservation for New Year’s Eve with my girlfriend. I called the number on the website (on hotels.com) and told them I was looking for a room that overlooked the Space Needle so we could see the fireworks. The guy said he didn’t have any rooms overlooking the space needle but he would give us a room where we could see the fireworks. I made it clear we were only interested in reserving a hotel room if we could view the fireworks from the room. As we will later see, this was not the case. We got to the hotel and found street parking. When we arrived at the counter the staff seemed very nice. I asked them if there was hotel parking, because I didn’t want to have to move my car before the next day. They told me street parking was free on New Year’s and they also had free hotel parking in another lot. Later I asked for one of these passes before I left to eat at a restaurant. The staff seemed good intentioned, but completely incompetent. My girlfriend is Japanese and one of the staff members told us there were a number of good restaurants in the area and then told my girlfriend there is bubble tea if she wants some. Neither of us said anything, because we both were surprised by the comment. He then continued to ask her if she likes bubble tea. It seemed like a weird and completely unprofessional thing to say, but I just thought “whatever.” Next, we went up to the room. I looked out the window and it was a view of the other side of the building. There was absolutely no view whatsoever of fireworks or any park of the city for that matter. It was a completely blocked off view. I went back to the desk and told them we specifically asked for a room with a view of the fireworks. The lady said that there weren’t any rooms with a view of the fireworks. I asked her why the hotel staff member on the phone said there was. She said I booked the reservation through hotels.com and they were the ones at fault, not the hotel. She said they have had problems with hotels.com in the past. She said there was nothing she could do and that I could try to cancel my reservation through hotel.com if I wanted to. I told her we had nowhere else to go and we were promised a view of the fireworks (it actually said we wanted a view of the Space Needle on the reservation printout she gave me). I said they need to take responsibility for hotels.com mistakes if they are going to contract with them. After attempting to reason with her for way too long she finally told me I they would tell hotels.com they would grant the cancellation and that I could still stay in the room. When we finally got to the point of speaking with hotels.com and giving her the phone to grant the permission she said to me “so we are going to cancel your reservation and that means you are going to have to check out of the hotel.” At this point I was extremely frustrated. I told her she just told me a second ago that she said I could stay in the hotel for free. Long story short, it got to the point where I finally reasoned with her. She called her manager and asked him if I could stay in the room for free and the manager granted that (side note: while she was on the phone with the manager the bubble tea guy was telling me in a very illogical, confusing way that the hotel was full and I might not be able to stay there unless the manager granted it. I told him we already had a room. Long story short, these two hotel staff were complete idiots). The next day… I went to checkout and there were two new hotel staff at the counter (these two were middle age, so I figured they might be a little smarter due to life experience). The lady took my room keys and parking pass. She said she was going to charge me $15 for parking. I told her the hotel staff told me it was free and that I didn’t even use the pass because I was lucky enough to find street parking again. She said “I see on the computer what happened last night. Parking is $15 and I’m charging it to your card.” I told her again that the hotel staff told me it was free. In a very aggressive tone she said “You’re a con artist.” I was shocked. She told me she didn’t want to listen to my side of the story. This business does not deserve to stay in business. If you believe this situation is unacceptable, then please do not support this business. If you simply just need a place to stay and don’t deal with the hotel staff, then this place is just fine. The rooms are clean and comfortable. But there are plenty of other businesses out there competing for your business and I do not believe this hotel deserves to remain in business. Thanks for reading. These review sites seem to be the only tools for holding people accountable.

Reviews.Title: “New and Clean”
Reviews.Author: vroomvroom15
Reviews.Content: The Belltown is definitely priced for the budget-conscious traveller. It was by far the cheapest hotel in the heart of Seattle that I could find. There is neither a pool nor a spa, and the rooms are small and cozy - but can you really complain when costs are less than $100 a night? I thought that the Belltown was an amazing deal. The staff was friendly, the house was very clean, and it was a 10 minute walk to the Pike Market and the Space Needle.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Belltown Inn Seattle”
