Reviews.Author: chrisweiAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find close to Pike Markets and city center. At Aus$130 this was a bargain. Spacious and quiet with good internet access. The immediate surrounding area is a bit seedy but I would not be put off by this.

Reviews.Title: “good, budget priced hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: whistler2010
Reviews.Content: A reasonable accomodation, but a bit out of the way if you are waking. The staff was very pleasant. Free internet was available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “This place far exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: PortlandPabst
Reviews.Content: This place has a two-star rating which blows me away! I would not normally book a room at a hotel with a score this low, but after reading all the guest reviews I took a chance, and have nothing but positive things to say! The room was completely renovated and immaculate, every staff member I dealt with was wonderful, there's off-street parking in a safe lot, you can walk everywhere, and it's super affordable for what you get (we paid $115/night including taxes/fees/etc). I will always stay at The Belltown Inn when I visit Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “value in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: soltailor
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Belltown Inn were unfailingly nice during our stay, and handled every request promptly. If you need quiet, then book an inside (courtyard) room. The inner rooms are quiet but small, and the outer rooms are very large and can accommodate a family easily (but are subject to the sounds of the busses along Third Avenue). Rooms were clean and smoke-free (the entire building is smoke-free). Parking was no problem (two nearby lots have arrangements with the hotel). If you don't want a luxury room (at a luxe price), then the Belltown is a good value in downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “You cannot go wrong with the Belltown Inn”
Reviews.Author: noahg13
Reviews.Content: I had 9 days to find a place to stay for the summer and found the BTI on an internet search. Set to work right in Belltown and having never been to Seattle before, I was surprised to find a place so close yet so affordable. I took a chance and booked a room, figuring if it was terrible I would leave. Surely, this was too good to be true, right? Let me tell you: having spent nearly the last 3 months at the BTI the hotel exceeds expectations in every way. Hell, it exceeds the expectations of hotels twice or three times the price. The staff is phenomenal, always helpful and super-friendly. The rates are a downright steal. The rooms have everything you need, including a mini-kitchette for "monthlies" like myself. Plus, you are in the heart of Belltown and everything you need is within walking distance (A tip however: avoid the grocery store near the dog park. Their prices are confiscatory. $15 for a bottle of Tide detergent. No, I am not kidding.) Look, if you are hot for an Olympic swimming pool and 4-star restaurant attached to the place you stay in, you won't find it here. Go downtown and pay six times the price if that matters so much to you. Otherwise, if you want a safe, clean, affordable, nice place to stay for a day, a week, a month or several months, YOU CANNOT GO WRONG WITH THE BELLTOWN INN. I will say it again: YOU CANNOT GO WRONG WITH THE BELLTOWN INN.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in seattle”
Reviews.Author: msgrad
Reviews.Content: The Belltown Inn is located in the Belltown, close to everything in Seattle. You can walk to Pike Market, The Needle, restuarants, museums and the waterfront. The people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful and quick to scan the internet for directions points, of interest or anything you might want. The hotel has recently been renovated, but does not include airconditioning and most of the time the fan is fine. At 80 dollars a night for a weeks stay you can not find a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly welcoming hotel - Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: DavidBath
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is good as it's within the free bus zone and within easy walking distance of the Pike Market; Cruise terminals and Seattle Space Needle. The neighbourhood is slightly seedy but there are good eating and drinking places close by. The rooftop terrace is a real bonus and allows you to meet other guests and have a glass of wine whilst enjoying excellent views over Seattle. The rooms are a good size and spotless, but lack air conditioning (an issue whilst we were in Seattle because it was really hot) and if you left the window open then the close proximity of other rooms across the courtyard meant that there was quite a lot of noise. All the reception staff were extremely pleasant and helpful and we really enjoyed our stay despite the minor drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: gogomn
Reviews.Content: We were first-time travelers to Seattle and thought the Belltown looked like a nice place to stay, the rate was terrific and we liked the location. It was four blocks from where our cruise ship was docked, it was within walking distance to Pike's market, the waterfront and the space needle. We found great restaurants and a small grocery store nearby. The staff was very friendly and helpful and our room was very clean. The only downside was that the area seems to attract some drug dealing and late-night/early-morning partiers. Fortunately, all parties got along :-)

Reviews.Title: “Everything is good except the noise”
Reviews.Author: jellicledog
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay this hotel again. Price, location, cleanliness, everything I usually need was very good, just the street noise was to complain about this hotel. The kitchenette is a real bonus. Yes it is not very nice neiborhood but I never felt unsefe at all even I walked alone just before midnight from theatre. I liked that there's a dog park across the street. I killed time there doing dog watching after checking out untill going to Bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky spot in a great city”
Reviews.Author: tracy6
Reviews.Content: very clean, very small room. recently redecor is nice some staff very helpful some not so. NO AIRCONDITIONING. Issue with Parking. close to downtownarea a little iffy.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Belltown Inn”
Reviews.Author: jcca510
Reviews.Content: Stayed six nights while in town for a conference. Not right on top of the convention center, but close enough (15 min walk), and without the craziness of the shopping district. A short walk from plenty of restaurants, pike market, seattle center, etc. Was intrigued by all of the crackhead comments from other reviewers, and wanted to see if it was true. Turned out there wasn't much to see. Maybe there were a couple out there, but they seemed pretty friendly. Maybe it's not the season. Had a room facing the courtyard and it was pretty quiet. Yes, the rooms were not huge, but sufficient. Staff was friendly and helpful. Nice to have the kitchenette - whole foods market is about 10 min walk - stocked up for my stay. The only negative I could think of was lack of wireless internet access. They do have computers in a little business center which is nice, but hard to use if you really need to get some work done. I did rent a DSL modem from them which cost next to nothing and came in very handy. Overall, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: njdaveus
Reviews.Content: Clean, reasonably priced room in a new building just a few blocks from downtown are the best reasons to stay here. Great local restaurants and clubs would make this a good place to stay for a weekend away. Located by a bus stop within the free downtown bus zone is another plus. Grocery store a half-block down Third Ave makes the kitchenette and microwave a plus. Only complaint is that they only supply coffee for the in-room pots on the first night (you can buy additional packs) and housekeeping doesn't wash the coffee pot, cups, or glasses during my stay. The front desk staff are friendly, knowledgeable, and an asset.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: OrubOosocky
Reviews.Content: The staff was awesome. Very helpful, gave me very good recommendations of bars in the neighborhood. The room was small, but I could've care less for the price I was paying. I spent the first 4 days of my vacation by myself, so there was no issue. The bed took two nights to get used to, but I'm pretty sure most people would have that problem. The location was perfect, as I was in Seattle to see the city, mostly. Everything was within 15 minutes walking distance. There were some oddball people that spent their time in the neighborhood, but nothing to be worried about. At night, you might get asked for spare change for the bus or a spare cigarette, but never harassed or bothered. Honestly, I've never met nicer crackheads than the ones in Seattle. One even offered me part of her $10 million fortune! Next time I'm in Seattle, the Belltown Inn is number one on my list.

Reviews.Title: “great location and cute decor”
Reviews.Author: chicknamedvick
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for Valentine's Day weekend and the room, service, decor, and location were really great. The staff gave us a great recommendation for a breakfast cafe that had the best bacon. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Belltown”
Reviews.Author: jcnetdev
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel dozens of times. I've had contact with every member of the staff and they are all amazingly nice people. The hotel itself is brand new. Rooms are nice, and I've never had any noise bother me. Parking may be a problem, and the corner its on isnt the greatest at night, but despite that, I'll continue to stay at Belltown Inn any time I need to do business in Seattle. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sonicpony
Reviews.Content: I think it is my duty to warn you to not go to this place. it is awful. 1. Immediate area is SKETCHY (junkies across the street smoking crack, beer drinking during the day in the empty lot next door...) 2. Hotel does not have it's own parking - so you must self-park about 1/2 a block down the road in an unsecure lot in a sketchy area... (costs $15 day) 3. Rude and awful staff (ok, well ONE of them, but she ruined my stay.. see below). I came to down for a wedding and was pleased with the price of 109. However, I should have known you get what you pay for. Room was ok and clean but nothing to write home about. Definitely fine for the money although the towels were probably the worst towels I've ever used. Parking- the staff told me I needed a parking pass for the lot for each day I was to stay. They alerted me that the passes expire at "12 noon or 2pm - can't remember"... so each day I went to buy a new pass for the lot. An inconvenience but I was paying so little overall I just went with it. Upon my check out I was approached by this older lady who came by to "get back my old parking passes". I told her I didn't save them (why would I keep my old paper parking passes?).. then she became enraged telling me that she was now going to have to charge me 250 bucks apiece for these paper passes (!!)remember, these are for paper parking passes no one ever instructed me to hold onto. Apparently, one pass is good for your entire stay but the staff clearly didn't know this and didn't communicate this to me. Regardless, she continued to threaten me as if I was "holding out" on her. I told her there would be no reason or benefit for me to keep the passes from her if I had them but did not have a time machine to retrieve them at this point. She stormed off on me after I told her I was in shock about her level of unprofessionalism and rudeness. The funny thing is that the old passes ended up being on the floor of my rental car and I gave them to another employee - but the point of the matter is that this horrifying and embarassing incident completely ruined my experience in this godawful place. It was bad until then but that incident was just the topper. I kept reminding myself that that kind of white trash is just what you can expect from such a sketchy spot. it didn't make me feel better. do yourself a favor and stay at the new Silver Cloud like my friends did. They loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBabette
Reviews.Content: I found this new hotel by searching for extended stays in downtown Seattle. WOW!! FINALLY an inexpensive hotel in downtown Seattle without emptying out our wallets! AND, you don't need a car - everything was in walking distance!! The front desk people (awesome service) had us heading to every eclectic, fabulous cafe, restaurant and shop in the area (all within a block or two), and we even did the touristy thing and walked up and down the boardwalk on the bay checking everything out. Macys, Nordstroms and all of the great downtown shopping is in walking distance too - and theatres, etc. The studios are a bit smaller than, say, the Hilton or Sheraton, but on the upside they were very cozy and clean. Loved having the kitchenette. You have to pay for Internet in your room (small fee), but we used the Internet in the free business center . I highly recommend you stay here - they really are terrific, and you can't beat the value!

Reviews.Title: “Cracktacular location, but good price for what you get (clean safe room).”
Reviews.Author: xanadugirlz
Reviews.Content: The first thing I must say is if you hate noise, book an interior room (facing a little courtyard and fountain. If you get a room facing the street be prepared to hear crackheads (and I say this, because you can literally watch them hitting their pipes in the alley accross the street) ALL NIGHT LONG. All that being said, you are downtown in a big city, and whether you are here, or somewhere higher end like the Fairmont/Hyatt, there are those types of people outside (more here, but you WILL see them anywhere), and they pretty much are not there to harrass you....they just do their little cracky thing in peace. We got this while we are moving our place isnt ready for 2 weeks....so this is a good value for in town (if you are willing to not be in town , there are many extended stay properties in Kent and beyond that offer more amenties for a lower price) In fact I think it is the best value in town. The building is secure. The staff is very nice. The room is TINY.....think Motel 6 in size (for long term living this is not) with a little kitchenette, and flat panel tv. Internet is NOT free (why?) except in the business center, and there is no specified parking, you have to park down the street in a $15 a night lot, or hope to find parking on the street (but move your car beetween 8am-6pm daily).....The room is very clean.....no a/c but rarely would you need it....there is heat (in winter youll need it) really I don;t have any complaints about the property itself besides the parking and pay internet, the location/noise thing isnt there fault, and for the price Im happy to just be somewhere safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the right traveller”
Reviews.Author: cross-check
Reviews.Content: Centrally located this place is perfect if you're not carborn and/or want to live downtown Seattle with close proximity to the waterfront. Best value for monthly stays. Rooms (queen bed, one person) are new and clean, furniture OK. Kitchenette has everything. Good storage room for both shoes, clothes and bags. Big and nice desk and LCD TV that's not in the way. Staff is friendly and efficient, front desk open 24 hours which feels safe. Could be better: affordable parking options, internet these days should be complimentary and wireless (they have a business centre but that's SO not attractive), mirror (one in bathroom only), noise reduction from the street (thin windows), cooling options (no airconditioning, hot in summer!) Area is a local neighbourhood, pretty tourist-free. Lots of good places for wining and dining at resonable cost. Some streets are less attractive and easily avioded. Perfect for young or solo travellers looking for long-term stays downtown.

HotelInfo.Name: Belltown Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 2301 3rd Avenue, Seattle, WA
